# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
 MiddleMan(io::IO, text, text_width) do io# Use an IO context for writing to a buffer
 line = ""
 for word in split(text, r" \t\r\n") # Split text by whitespace or newline
 if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width # Check if new line is needed
 println(io, line) # Print previous line
 line = "" # Reset line for next word
 end
 line *= word # Add word to line if it fits
 end
 if length(line) > 0 # Print last line
 println(io, line)
 end
 end
 return nothing # Function returns nothing
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped at 10 character width."
println(wrap_string(text))
